ygData.subject: RE: [eqbards] Re: Patch Message
ygData.msgSnippet: I wonder how many bards, or for that matter, how many of each class go anon or roleplay. I would say a bard count is infinitely more accurate than say a wizard
ygData.messageBody:
I wonder how many bards, or for that matter, how many of each class go anon
or roleplay.

I would say a bard count is infinitely more accurate than say a wizard or
druid count.

I think I've been directly asked to help locate a corpse maybe three times,
and I'm never roleplay or anon. It used to be a pain when /consent = loot,
cause you had no option but to drag the person along with you, which
invariably led to him cancelling autofollow when hit by a mob you usually
outrun, cancelling autofollow when he fell too far behind, etc ad nauseum.
Now that /consent = drag, it takes about 25% of the time and effort it used
to. Pulse locate, selos, autorun. If I have to maneuver, pulse, selos,
autorun...then drag back. Now the worst part is how fast you gotta hit drag
when running...it takes no time at all to get out of drag range. Feel like
I"m playing the old arcade "Track and Field". :)

Course, with my lvl 20 halfling druid, I appear at a circle, and more often
than not, I get 2 or so tells asking if I can port, whether I'm anon or not
(usually am).

OMG...I rambled again...I'll shutup for a couple mins. :)

Oh, btw, it took me way too long to get 1 bubble into 30 yesterday. I was
in a full group in OT, beating up stuff yellow/red to me, constant pulls. I
always thought hell levels were made out to be worse than they are...now I
see they're worse than I thought...hehe. Oh well...

Atonal

-----Original Message-----
From: blitz_krieg@... [mailto:blitz_krieg@...]
Sent: Monday, February 26, 2001 2:09 PM
To: eqbards@yahoogroups.com
Subject: [eqbards] Re: Patch Message

>I snipped...
(BTW, the 74 isn't an accurate count with anon/roleplay)
